NODE_TEXT:
A one-off compilation of the overall program is required at the start. Following this a compilation of the changes will suffice.

When compiling in PCS 7 it is important that the "Generate module drivers" option is always selected where HW Config of the AS has been changed beforehand.

Note

As of PCS 7 V7.0, the two options "Make textual interconnections" and "Delete Empty Runtime Groups" are no longer available in the compilation dialog; they appear in the CFC editor instead. The sampling times are updated during every compilation.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 9.2 Downloading the user program

Loading the hardware and the network configuration into the AS are conditions for downloading the user program. You can find information about this in the following sections:

- Creating and managing a PCS 7 project (Page 51)
- Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O) (Page 89)
- Configuration of the network connections (Page 149)

Note

Do not load any blocks directly from the block folder of the SIMATIC Manager with PCS 7; download the charts solely via the selected chart folder in the SIMATIC Manager or via the function in the CFC/SFC Editor.

You can also download changes directly to the chart folder without starting compilation beforehand.

As of PCS 7 V7.0, the two options "Make textual interconnections" and "Delete Empty Runtime Groups" are no longer available in the compilation dialog; they appear in the CFC editor instead. The sampling times are updated during every compilation.

When compiling in PCS 7 it is important that the "Generate module drivers" option is always selected where HW Config of the AS has been changed beforehand.

Note

As of PCS 7 V7.0, the two options "Make textual interconnections" and "Delete Empty Runtime Groups" are no longer available in the compilation dialog; they appear in the CFC editor instead. The sampling times are updated during every compilation.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 9.2 Downloading the user program

Loading the hardware and the network configuration into the AS are conditions for downloading the user program. You can find information about this in the following sections:

- Creating and managing a PCS 7 project (Page 51)
- Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O) (Page 89)
- Configuration of the network connections (Page 149)

Note

Do not load any blocks directly from the block folder of the SIMATIC Manager with PCS 7; download the charts solely via the selected chart folder in the SIMATIC Manager or via the function in the CFC/SFC Editor.

You can also download changes directly to the chart folder without starting compilation beforehand.

# 9.2 Downloading the user program

Loading the hardware and the network configuration into the AS are conditions for downloading the user program. You can find information about this in the following sections:

- Creating and managing a PCS 7 project (Page 51)
- Configuration of the hardware (AS and I/O) (Page 89)
- Configuration of the network connections (Page 149)

Note

Do not load any blocks directly from the block folder of the SIMATIC Manager with PCS 7; download the charts solely via the selected chart folder in the SIMATIC Manager or via the function in the CFC/SFC Editor.

You can also download changes directly to the chart folder without starting compilation beforehand.
Q: What sections are mentioned for finding information about the configuration of the hardware and network connections in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A: For hardware and network configurations, see pages 89 and 149 respectively.

NODE_TEXT:
A one-off compilation of the overall program is required at the start. Following this a compilation of the changes will suffice.

When compiling in PCS 7 it is important that the "Generate module drivers" option is always selected where HW Config of the AS has been changed beforehand.

Note

As of PCS 7 V7.0, the two options "Make textual interconnections" and "Delete Empty Runtime Groups" are no longer available in the compilation dialog; they appear in the CFC editor instead. The sampling times are updated during every compilation.
